bibl.title: Letter from F.H. Morris to Mabel H. Lazear, November 26, 1900

div1.p: Morris reports that he will investigate what money may be due Mabel Lazear for Lazear's army services.

div1.head: Letter from F.H. Morris to Mabel H. Lazear, November 26, 1900
div1.opener:
W.H.S.
FHG
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
OFFICE OF AUDITOR FOR THE WAR DEPARTMENT
Washington,November 26, 1900.
#88409:
In answering this letter address “Auditor
for the War Department,” and refer
to above number.
Mrs. Mabel H. Lazear,
1121 Park Avenue,
Baltimore, Md.
Madam:
div1.p:
Your letter, inclosing your appointment as asministratrix
of the estate of Jesse W. Lazear, late Acting Asst. Surgn., U.
S. A., together with contract, has been received and accepted
as an application for what may be due because of the officer's
services, and the matter will be disposed of at the earliest
practicable date.
div1.closer:
Respectfully, F. H. Morris.
Auditor. JEC
B.H.
